chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Robert A Zehnder was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

Case called at 10:44 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Robert A Zehnder in court, in-custody, with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADABrookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon questioning of the Court, Counsel indicate that they do not contest the examiner's findings

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest & Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty but Not Guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.

Court orders that conditional release plan be prepared within 21 days and endorses orders as submitted by Atty Zarwell
Recess: 10:53 am

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1500  Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no direct or indirect contact with Trevor Reed
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
--to submit to booking at the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today
The Court informs the parties that this case will transfer to Judge Wambach/Branch III in January.
